comments.creator: pjenvey@mozilla.com
comments.author: pjenvey@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
#### Bug Fixes

*   don't consider expiry during batch commit (#632) ([90ff7485](https://github.com/mozilla-services/syncstorage-rs/commit/90ff74858f10f5e52f1acd60a57f6a2ead46c891))


FYI:

The above mentioned issue (expired data that has not been purged conflicting with data uploaded in batches, triggering an AlreadyExists error) has caught some clients who have been repeatedly failing to sync, w/ the AlreadyExists giving them 500 errors. This usually hits their history collection.

They should now successfully sync. We may see more batch commits succeeding temporarily as they "catch up". It doesn't seem to have affected very many users (per the 500 rates it's produced). I don't foresee us noticing the "catching up" other than the lowering of 500 rates.
